property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: Following this road leads to the gate to the Ketsukane Estate. The gate only opens after completing the [[Steamworks]] on a [[Pacifist Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Ketsukane Estate

property.name: description
property.value: After a cutscene with [[Martlet]], Clover enters Oasis Valley through this path.

property.name: description
property.value: The road to the Wild East is through this hallway.

property.name: page
property.value: Wild East

property.name: description
property.value: This arcade machine lets [[Clover]] play Mew Mew Love Blaster! for 3G.

property.name: page
property.value: Mew Mew Love Blaster!

property.name: description
property.value: If [[Clover]] knocks on this door, the person inside just responds they're not home.

property.name: description
property.value: This flower was planted by the [[Rock Man]]; the whole town takes care of it. It grows in stages over the course of the game. On a [[Genocide Route]], it has withered away by the time [[Clover]] enters.

property.name: description
property.value: The Rock Man tells [[Clover]] about their attempts to grow plants, including the grass next to them and the flower in the plant shelter south of their house. They share some information about the Meadows. After returning to enter the [[Ketsukane Estate]] on the [[Pacifist Route]], the Rock Man is now outside by the Oasis. They comment on the increased activity at the estate.

property.name: page
property.value: Rock Man

properties.property: The Fortune Teller offers [[Clover]] a bite-sized fortune for 5G. They can buy up to four fortunes. The fortunes are: * Her predicting Clover getting into a "tumble," then realizing she misunderstood "tumbleweed," * Her predicting the time the player's computer will be on in 2 minutes, * Her seeing death in Clover's future, * Her seeing [[ut:Frisk|Frisk]] walking past the water cooler in [[Hotland]]. She returns Clover's 5G for this fortune.

property.name: page
property.value: Fortune Teller

property.name: description
property.value: Sandra comments on the ice hockey table functioning poorly. They also mention hearing plans to reforest the [[Dunes]].

property.name: description
property.value: The Café Dune Clerk tells [[Clover]] they cannot buy items, since they, the manager, are on strike.

property.name: description
property.value: The Modernist sits in the [[Café Dune]], drinking tea and bragging about using technology.

property.name: description
property.value: The Gamer Kid talks about the games the arcade has. They offer to hang out with [[Clover]] some time. They mention their friend group having less members recently, hinting at [[Kanako Ketsukane]]'s disappearance.

property.name: page
property.value: Gamer Kid

property.name: description
property.value: After exiting the [[Ketsukane Estate]] on a [[Pacifist Route]], Sir Slither can be found by the entrance. He offers to accompany [[Clover]] on their journey.

property.name: page
property.value: Sir Slither

property.name: description
property.value: Aunt Glover rambles about the different ways to categorize heat. If [[Donald Glover]]'s mitten was returned, she asks about how he is doing.

property.name: page
property.value: Aunt Glover

property.name: description
property.value: Drinki silently drinks the water from the oasis. They disappear after exiting the [[Ketsukane Estate]] on a [[Pacifist Route]].

property.name: description
property.value: Red, a cameo from the fangame UnderTale RED, can be found here. If [[Martlet]] is accompanying, her and Red will talk about how Martlet mistook her for a human a week ago. Martlet offers her a job at the Royal Guard. If [[Clover]] is alone, she awkwardly converses.

property.name: description
property.value: The Sandstorm Stander from the earlier sandstorm puzzle in the [[Dunes]] complains about the heat.

property.name: page
property.value: Sandstorm Stander

property.name: description
property.value: After sparing [[Starlo]] on a [[Pacifist Route]], Violetta can be found here tending to the sprout.

property.name: description
property.value: Hugtony, possibly a specimen [[Cactony]], sits at a booth offering free hugs. However, if [[Clover]] talks to them, Hugtony goes back and forth on wanting a hug, eventually reaching the conclusion to not hug Clover.

property.name: description
property.value: Three Frostermits with pyramids on their backs sit inside the fenced in area.

property.name: description
property.value: Mr. Sir appears during [[Fun_Value#Game_Machine|Fun Values]] 65 through 69. He tries to prevent [[Clover]] from being interested in the broken machine beside him.

property.name: page
property.value: Mr. Sir

property.name: description
property.value: The Oasis Valley UGPS sign.

property.name: page
property.value: Underground Postal Service

properties.property: "Welcome to Oasis Valley! Home to the largest body of water in the Dunes!"
"(A child's drawing depicting three happy monsters.) My precious family - by me :)"

property.name: page
property.value: Kanako Ketsukane

properties.property: Café Dune is referred to as the most modern part of the [[Dunes]]. Since the clerk/manager is on strike, no items can be bought here. Only on a [[Genocide Route]] can [[Clover]] steal the following items: * [[Icewater]] * [[Oasis Latte]] * [[Cinnamon Cookie]] * [[Floral Cupcake]]

property.name: page
property.value: Café Dune

property.name: description
property.value: This spider sells [[Clover]] some [[Spider Donut]]s. They can buy up to four.

property.name: page
property.value: Bake Sale Spider

property.name: description
property.value: 30G can be stolen from this pair of pants.
